intro: Centaurea austriaca var. flosculosa, commonly known as the Austrian knapweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces bright yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges, and the plant thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
